books.title: USMLE
books.subtitle: Step 2 CS: Complex Cases
books.subtitle2: 35 Cases You Are Likely To See on the Exam
books.tagline: Proven, practical tools to help you score higher
books.author: Phillip Brottman, MD and Sonia Reichert, MD
books.legal: USMLE is a registered trademark of the Federation of State Medical Boards (FSMB) and the National Board of Medical Examiners (NBME), neither of which sponsors nor endorses this book.
keyPoints: Expert advice on how to master the most complex cases you'll see
Topics include work physicals, healthy check-ups, telephone calls, and end-of-life issues
In-depth coverage of the initial approach to complex cases and patient note-writing
BONUS: Tearout flashcard section based upon "doorway information"

books.title: USMLE
books.subtitle: Step 2 Clinical Skills
books.tagline: Proven, practical tools to help you score higher
books.legal: USMLE is a registered trademark of the Federation of State Medical Boards (FSMB) and the National Board of Medical Examiners (NBME), neither of which sponsors nor endorses this book.
keyPoints: Expert advice on how to master the exam
Proven strategies for doctor-patient communication and history taking
Effective tactics for the physical exam
Exclusive tips for writing the patient note
35 practice cases with answers and explanations

books.title: USMLE
books.subtitle: Step 3 CS: More Complex Cases
books.subtitle2: 45 Cases You Are Very Likely To See on the Exam
books.tagline: Proven, practical tools to help you score higher
books.author: Michael Brattman, MD and Sarah Ripart, MD
books.legal: USMLE is a registered trademark of the Federation of State Medical Boards (FSMB) and the National Board of Medical Examiners (NBME), neither of which sponsors nor endorses this book.
keyPoints: Real world scenarios to prepare you for the exam
Topics include telephone calls, paperwork, patient evaluation and screenings
In-depth coverage of the many facets of intricate analysis within a context framework
Helpful diagrams detailing intricate systems involving patient response methods
Expert analysis on exam pattern recognition and rational approaches to problem solving techniques
